entry.title: Lift My Heart to Your Ear
entry.summary:
Author: ArtaxLivs

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,614Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 14

Summary: Spurned on by a day of binging Harry Potter movies, young Stiles decides to cast a spell to ensure that the person he falls in love with is to impossible to exist.“Why don’t you want to fall in love?” Scott asks when they’re standing in the middle of the backyard, lit only from the light on the back porch since there’s no moon tonight. A new moon, Stiles thinks absently but something in him tells him that new moons are best for new beginnings.“Because loving someone means letting them hurt you, even if they don’t want to, even if they’re…dead,” Stiles replies softly, hoping Scott will understand and not make him talk about how much he misses her, how much Stiles misses him, even though his dad is still alive.

entry.title: The Creator's Game
entry.summary:
Author: Glitter_Lips

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 127,811Chapters: 36/36Kudos: 44

Summary: Everyone in my story is dead. Alec has been a Beacon Hills resident and a McCall pack member for just over a year, and he’s finally starting to feel comfortable and safe after his near death experience at the hands of Monroe and her hunter army. He doesn’t want to get involved in the war ever again, content to play lacrosse and live his life.But Monroe isn’t finished yet, and she won’t rest until all supernatural people are wiped out for good. Her plans won’t allow Alec to stay uninvolved forever, and his past threatens to catch up with him no matter how badly he had hoped to keep those secrets buried.

entry.title: Copain of the black wolf.
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 196,713Chapters: 24/40Kudos: 817

Summary: A Sterek rewrite of the show, that stays mostly canon compliant in the beginning, shown exclusively through the eyes of Stiles Stilinski, unknown soul mate of Derek Hale.Starts slow emotionally, my first attempt at a story of this degree please be gentle.Stiles grunted softly as he heaved himself onto the roof, his sneakers scuffing against the shingles. Scott—his best friend since forever—wasn’t answering his phone, and Stiles couldn’t wait. There was no way Scott was going to believe what Stiles had just overheard.Keeping low, Stiles crept along the roof toward Scott’s window, his heart racing as the cool night air pressed against his skin. He tried the window, but it wouldn’t budge—it was locked.“Of course it’s locked,” he muttered under his breath, rolling his eyes.Knocking softly on the glass, he leaned in closer, squinting to peer inside. The curtains were drawn, giving him only a hazy, distorted view of the room beyond. “Scott,” he hissed, rapping on the window again. No answer.Suddenly, the curtains shifted, and the window flung open. Scott and Stiles screamed, startling each other.

entry.title: Pure Madness
entry.summary:
Author: Hamahthesith

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,106Chapters: 7/20Kudos: 10

Summary: Stiles could still remember the first time his mother explained the importance of epigenetic memory. In spite of the trauma associated with such genetic continuity, she stressed the importance of remembrance in all of its various forms. He hadn't truly understood until a madness claimed Beacon Hills as it's home. Only he has the genetic continuity, the memories, to free the minds of their hometown. With the occasional assistance of an overbearing sour wolf, oh, and his pack of wolves.

entry.title: The Architecture of Us: A Year of Mending
entry.summary:
Author: DarkInsanity (Stereklenidus)

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,166Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 51

Summary: From pining teenager to resident warlock of Beacon Hills, Stiles Stilinski spent years loving Derek Hale from the shadows, watching him build a pack that had no place for him. Misunderstandings, missed invitations, and a regifted compass built a fortress of heartbreak between them. But when a single moment of raw truth shatters the silence, they begin a year-long journey of mending. Through quiet gestures, earned trust, and the slow integration of pack and heart, they dismantle the walls, brick by brick, learning that the very scars of their past could become the foundation for an unshakable future, and a love written in stone.

  • Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

entry.title: I'm Just a Boy, Not a Hero (Just a Boy, Who Had to Sing this Song)
entry.summary:
Author: am0rawr

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,914Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 5

Summary: After the nuclear war, the world was divided between what remained of the earth and what turned to ash. From the ruins, the Argent Empire rose — a kingdom of steel and silence, where luxury hides fear and obedience is law. Inside the palace, Mieczysław lives as a living ornament, a prisoner among gold and glass, his existence shaped to please the man who destroyed everything he once loved. In the shadows, Derek Hale carries the weight of a murdered family. He enters the palace seeking vengeance — and finds, at the heart of his enemy, something he never expected: someone just as captive as himself. What begins as rebellion becomes a dangerous bond, woven from pain, desire, and silence.A forbidden love, born within the ruins — strong enough to reignite everything the empire tried to erase.

Summary: After Tobias Budge attacked Hannibal Lecter, Will Graham gets a phone call, his friend, John Stilinski, is dead, and his son, Stiles Stilinski, is in a coma. Emerging from a three-week coma, Stiles was told that his father, John Stilinski, had died in the accident that led to his coma, and that he had to find himself back in 2013. entry.title: The Howling Silence.
entry.summary:
Author: DarkInsanity (Stereklenidus)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,412Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 141

Summary: For years, Stiles Stilinski loved Derek Hale from the shadows, a master of quiet yearning. He watched Derek build a pack, a family, a life that had no place for a warlock's heart. Through birthdays forgotten, invitations missed, and a compass regifted, Stiles learned the painful architecture of unrequited love, folding his hope away until it was brittle. But when a threat in a dusty magic shop finally shatters Derek's control, the raw, possessive truth comes howling out. The question is, after so many years of silence, is Stiles still brave enough to reach for it?
